title: nf-core/airrflow pipeline parameters
description: B and T cell repertoire analysis pipeline with the Immcantation framework.

input_output_options.title: Input output options
input_output_options.description: Define where the pipeline should find input data and save output data.

input.description: Path to comma-separated file containing information about the samples in the experiment.
input.help_text: You will need to create a design file with information about the samples in your experiment before running the pipeline. Use this parameter to specify its location. It has to be a comma-separated file with 3 columns, and a header row. See [usage docs](https://nf-co.re/airrflow/usage#samplesheet-input).

mode.description: Specify the processing mode for the pipeline. Available options are "fastq" and "assembled".

outdir.description: The output directory where the results will be saved. You have to use absolute paths to storage on Cloud infrastructure.

email.help_text: Set this parameter to your e-mail address to get a summary e-mail with details of the run sent to you when the workflow exits. If set in your user config file (`~/.nextflow/config`) then you don't need to specify this on the command line for every run.

protocol.title: Protocol
protocol.description: Experimental protocol used to generate the data

library_generation_method.description: Protocol used for the V(D)J amplicon sequencing library generation.
library_generation_method.help_text:
Available protocols are:
- `specific_pcr_umi`: RT-PCR using transcript-specific primers containing UMIs.
- `specific_pcr`: RT-PCR using transcript-specific primers.
- `dt_5p_race_umi`: 5’-RACE PCR using oligo-dT primers and template switch primers containing UMI.
- `dt_5p_race`: 5’-RACE PCR (i.e. RT is followed by a template switch (TS) step) using oligo-dT primers.
- `sc_10x_genomics`:10x genomics library preparation protocol for scVDJ sequencing.

race_linker.description: Path to fasta file containing the linker sequence, if no V-region primers were used but a linker sequence is present (e.g. 5' RACE SMARTer TAKARA protocol).

primer_input_and_positions.title: Primer input and positions
primer_input_and_positions.description: Define the primer region start and how to deal with the primer alignment.

vprimers.description: Path to a fasta file containinc the V-region primer sequences.

cprimers.description: Path to a fasta file containing the C-region primer sequences.

vprimer_start.description: Start position of V region primers (without counting the UMI barcode).

cprimer_start.description: Start position of C region primers (without counting the UMI barcode).

cprimer_position.description: Indicate if C region primers are in the R1 or R2 reads.

primer_revpr.description: Specify to match the tail-end of the sequence against the reverse complement of the primers. This also reverses the behavior of the --start argument, such that start position is relative to the tail-end of the sequence. (default: False)Maximum scoring error for the Presto MaxPrimer process for the C and/or V region primers identification.

umi_barcode_handling.title: UMI barcode handling
umi_barcode_handling.description: Define how UMI barcodes should be treated.

umi_position.description: Indicate if UMI indices are recorded in the R1 (default) or R1 fastq file.
umi_position.help_text: The pipeline requires UMI barcodes for identifying unique transcripts. These barcodes are typically read from an index file but sometimes can be provided merged with the start of the R1 or R2 reads. If provided in an additional index file, set the `--index_file` parameter, if provided merged with the R1 or R2 reads, set the `--umi_position` parameter to R1 or R2, respectively.

umi_length.description: UMI barcode length in nucleotides. Set to 0 if no UMIs present.

umi_start.description: UMI barcode start position in the index read.

index_file.description: Indicate if UMI indices are recorded in a separate index file.
index_file.help_text:
Set to `true` if UMI barcodes are to be read from a separate Illumina index fastq file. If Illumina indices and UMI barcodes are already integrated into the R1 reads, leave the default `--index_file false`.

The pipeline requires UMI barcodes for identifying unique transcripts. These barcodes are typically read from an index file but sometimes can be provided merged with the start of the R1 or R2 reads. If provided in an additional index file, set the `--index_file` parameter, if provided merged with the R1 or R2 reads, set the `--umi_position` parameter.

umi_barcode_handling.help_text: The pipeline requires indication of UMI barcode treatment (for identifying unique transcripts). These barcodes are typically read from an index file but sometimes can be provided merged with the start of the R1 or R2 reads. If provided in an additional index file, set the `--index_file` parameter, if provided merged with the R1 or R2 reads, set the `--umi_position` parameter. Specify the UMI barcode length with the `--umi_length` parameter. If no UMI barcodes are present, specify `--umi_length = 0` to use the sans-UMI subworkflow.

adapter_trimming.title: Adapter trimming
adapter_trimming.description: Options for adapter trimming and read clipping

trim_fastq.description: Whether to trim adapters in fastq reads with fastp.
trim_fastq.help_text: By default adapters will be auto-detected, but adapter sequences can also be provided in a `fasta` file with the `--adapter_fasta` option.

adapter_fasta.description: Fasta file with adapter sequences to be trimmed.

clip_r1.description: Number of bases to clip 5' in R1 reads.

clip_r2.description: Number of bases to clip 5' in R2 reads.

three_prime_clip_r1.description: Number of bases to clip 3' in R1 reads.

three_prime_clip_r2.description: Number of bases to clip 3' in R2 reads.

trim_nextseq.description: Trim adapters specific for Nextseq sequencing

sequence_assembly_options.title: Sequence Assembly options
sequence_assembly_options.description: Options for the pRESTO sequence assembly processes

filterseq_q.description: Quality threshold for pRESTO FilterSeq sequence filtering.

primer_consensus.description: Maximum error for building the primer consensus in the pRESTO Buildconsensus step.

buildconsensus_maxerror.description: Maximum error for building the sequence consensus in the pRESTO BuildConsensus step.

buildconsensus_maxgap.description: Maximum gap for building the sequence consensus in the pRESTO BuildConsensus step.

cluster_sets.description: Cluster sequences by similarity regardless of any annotation with pRESTO ClusterSets and annotate the cluster ID additionally to the UMI barcode.

primer_r1_maxerror.description: Maximum allowed error for R1 primer alignment.

primer_r2_maxerror.description: Maximum allowed error for R2 primer alignment.

maskprimers_align.description: Align primers instead of scoring them. Used for protocols without primer fixed positions.

primer_maxlen.description: Maximum allowed primer length when aligning the primers.

maskprimers_align_race.description: Use MaskPrimers align for a 5' RACE protocol.
maskprimers_align_race.help_text: It will align the C-primers with pRESTO MaskPrimers align, and extract the template-switch Oligo and/or linker with defined length in `--primer_r2_extract_len`.

maskprimers_extract.description: Use when primer sequences are unknown but when their approximate positions are known.
maskprimers_extract.help_text: Use in combination with `--primer_r1_extract_len` and `--primer_r2_extract_len` to define the sequence regions to cut corresponding to the approximate unknown primer sequence length prior to alignment. It is also possible to define a UMI barcode for extraction if it's position is unknown.

primer_r1_extract_len.description: R1 primer extract length when using `--maskprimers_extract`.

primer_r2_extract_len.description: R2 primer extract length when using `--maskprimers_extract`.

assemblepairs_sequential.description: Use AssemblePairs sequential instead of AssemblePairs align when assembling read pairs.

align_cregion.description: Align internal C-region for a more precise isotype characterization.

internal_cregion_sequences.description: Provide internal C-region sequences for a more precise C-region characterization. Then also set the `align_cregion` flag.

cregion_maxlen.description: Maximum allowed length when aligning the internal C-region.

cregion_maxerror.description: Maximum allowed error when aligning the internal C-region.

skip_alignment_filter.description: Skip filter step after alignment that ensures that locus should match the v_call chain, the sequence alignment should have at least 200 informative positions (excluding N or gaps), and maximum 10% N nucleotides in the alignment.

single_cell_analysis_options.title: Single cell analysis options
single_cell_analysis_options.description: Options specific for raw single cell input.

reference_10x.description: Path to the reference directory required by cellranger. Can either be directory or tar.gz.

single_cell_analysis_options.help_text: Options for running raw single cell data.

rnaseq_based_analysis_options.title: Unselected RNA-seq based analysis options
rnaseq_based_analysis_options.description: Options specific for raw unselected RNA-seq input.

trust4_cell_barcode_read.description: Specifies which read holds the barcodes

trust4_umi_read.description: Indicate if UMI indices are recorded in the R1 (default) or R1 fastq file.

trust4_read_format.description: Specifies where in the read the barcodes and UMIs can be found.
trust4_read_format.help_text: For further information see the TRUST4 [docs](https://github.com/liulab-dfci/TRUST4?tab=readme-ov-file#10x-genomics-data-and-barcode-based-single-cell-data).

trust4_barcode_whitelist.help_text: For further information see the TRUST4 [docs](https://github.com/liulab-dfci/TRUST4?tab=readme-ov-file#10x-genomics-data-and-barcode-based-single-cell-data).

rnaseq_based_analysis_options.help_text: Options for running raw RNA seq data.

vdj_annotation_options.title: VDJ annotation options
vdj_annotation_options.description: Options for the VDJ annotation processes.

reassign.description: Whether to reassign genes if the input file is an AIRR formatted tabulated file.

save_databases.description: Save databases so you can use the cache in future runs.

reference_fasta.description: Path to the germline reference fasta.
reference_fasta.help_text: By default, we provide a pre-downloaded version of the IMGT database. It is also possible to provide a custom reference fasta database. To fetch a fresh version of IMGT, set the `--fetch_imgt` parameter instead.

reference_igblast.description: Path to the cached igblast database.
reference_igblast.help_text: By default, we provide a pre-downloaded version of the IMGT database. It is also possible to provide a custom reference fasta database. To fetch a fresh version of IMGT, set the `--fetch_imgt` parameter instead.

fetch_imgt.description: Set this flag to fetch the IMGT reference data at runtime.

bulk_filtering_options.title: Bulk filtering options
bulk_filtering_options.description: Options for bulk sequence filtering after VDJ assignment.

collapseby.description: Name of the field used to collapse duplicated sequences.

detect_contamination.description: Whether to run the process to detect contamination.

remove_chimeric.description: Whether to apply the chimera removal filter.

clonal_analysis_options.title: Clonal analysis options
clonal_analysis_options.description: Define how the B-cell clonal trees should be calculated.

clonal_threshold.description: Set the clustering threshold Hamming distance value. Default: 'auto'

cloneby.description: Name of the field used to group data files to identify clones.

crossby.description: Name of the field used to identify external groups used to identify a clonal threshold.

lineage_tree_builder.description: Lineage tree software to use to build trees within Dowser. If you change the default, also set the `lineage_tree_exec` parameter.

lineage_tree_exec.description: Path to lineage tree building executable.

singlecell.description: Name of the field used to determine if a sample is single cell sequencing or not.

skip_all_clones_report.description: Skip report of EnchantR DefineClones for all samples together.

skip_report_threshold.description: Skip report of EnchantR FindThreshold for all samples together.

clonal_analysis_options.help_text:
By default, the pipeline will define clones for each of the samples, as two sequences having the same V-gene assignment, C-gene assignment, J-gene assignment, and junction length. Additionally, the similarity of the CDR3 sequences will be assessed by Hamming distances. 

A distance threshold for determining if two sequences come from the same clone or not is automatically determined by the process find threshold. Alternatively, a hamming distance threshold can be  manually set by setting the `--clonal_threshold` parameter.

translation_and_embedding_options.title: Translation and embedding options
translation_and_embedding_options.description: Options to generate BCR and TCR embeddings with Amulety

translate.description: Generate a sequence amino acid translation with IgBlast.

embeddings.help_text:
Provide a comma separated list of the embeddings to generate (e.g. antiberty,antiberta2 ). Currently supported embeddings are:
- BCR embeddings: antiberta2, antiberty, balmpaired.
- Unspecific embeddings: esm2.

embedding_chain.description: BCR or TCR chains to include for embedding.
embedding_chain.help_text: Provide "H" for heavy chain only (BCR: IGH, TCR: TRB, TRD), or "HL" for heavy and light chain (requires single-cell paired data with the column "cell_id"). Cells with only heavy chains will be removed prior to embedding when HL is selected.

report_css.description: Custom report style file in css format.

report_logo_img.description: Custom logo for the EnchantR reports.

skip_report.description: Skip repertoire analysis and report generation.

reference_genome_options.title: Reference genome options
reference_genome_options.description: Options for the reference genome indices used to align reads.

igenomes_ignore.description: Do not load the iGenomes reference config.
igenomes_ignore.help_text: Do not load `igenomes.config` when running the pipeline. You may choose this option if you observe clashes between custom parameters and those supplied in `igenomes.config`.

igenomes_base.description: The base path to the igenomes reference files

institutional_config_options.title: Institutional config options
institutional_config_options.description: Parameters used to describe centralised config profiles. These should not be edited.
institutional_config_options.help_text: The centralised nf-core configuration profiles use a handful of pipeline parameters to describe themselves. This information is then printed to the Nextflow log when you run a pipeline. You should not need to change these values when you run a pipeline.

custom_config_version.description: Git commit id for Institutional configs.

custom_config_base.help_text: If you're running offline, Nextflow will not be able to fetch the institutional config files from the internet. If you don't need them, then this is not a problem. If you do need them, you should download the files from the repo and tell Nextflow where to find them with this parameter.

generic_options.title: Generic options
generic_options.description: Less common options for the pipeline, typically set in a config file.
generic_options.help_text:
These options are common to all nf-core pipelines and allow you to customise some of the core preferences for how the pipeline runs.

Typically these options would be set in a Nextflow config file loaded for all pipeline runs, such as `~/.nextflow/config`.

publish_dir_mode.description: Method used to save pipeline results to output directory.
publish_dir_mode.help_text: The Nextflow `publishDir` option specifies which intermediate files should be saved to the output directory. This option tells the pipeline what method should be used to move these files. See [Nextflow docs](https://www.nextflow.io/docs/latest/process.html#publishdir) for details.

email_on_fail.description: Email address for completion summary, only when pipeline fails.
email_on_fail.help_text: An email address to send a summary email to when the pipeline is completed - ONLY sent if the pipeline does not exit successfully.

plaintext_email.description: Send plain-text email instead of HTML.

multiqc_title.description: MultiQC report title. Printed as page header, used for filename if not otherwise specified.

max_multiqc_email_size.description: File size limit when attaching MultiQC reports to summary emails.

monochrome_logs.description: Do not use coloured log outputs.

hook_url.description: Incoming hook URL for messaging service
hook_url.help_text: Incoming hook URL for messaging service. Currently, MS Teams and Slack are supported.

multiqc_config.description: Custom config file to supply to MultiQC.

multiqc_logo.description: Custom logo file to supply to MultiQC. File name must also be set in the MultiQC config file

multiqc_methods_description.description: Custom MultiQC yaml file containing HTML including a methods description.

validate_params.description: Boolean whether to validate parameters against the schema at runtime

pipelines_testdata_base_path.description: Base URL or local path to location of pipeline test dataset files

trace_report_suffix.description: Suffix to add to the trace report filename. Default is the date and time in the format yyyy-MM-dd_HH-mm-ss.

help_full.description: Display the full detailed help message.

show_hidden.description: Display hidden parameters in the help message (only works when --help or --help_full are provided).
